gw.bc.invoice.entity

Interface InvoiceStream

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Bean, com.guidewire.commons.entity.BundleProvider, java.lang.Comparable<Bean>, Editable, IGosuObject, InCurrencySilo, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.InCurrencySiloStubI, com.guidewire.bc.domain.invoice.gen.InvoiceStreamStubI, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Keyable, KeyableBean, Retireable, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Sourceable, com.guidewire.pl.system.entity.Subtype, com.guidewire.pl.system.entity.SubtypeBean, Validatable, com.guidewire.pl.domain.validation.gen.ValidatableStubI, Versionable

    public interface InvoiceStream
extends com.guidewire.bc.domain.invoice.gen.InvoiceStreamStubI
    An InvoiceStream is a stream of invoices for a paying Account or Producer. Invoices from different streams will not be combined even if the invoices are billed on the same day.

    The stream uses invoicing settings from its paying Account or Producer to determine the bill dates and due dates for its invoices. A stream can also override the settings of its payer to use its own invoice day, invoicing lead time, BillDateOrDueDateBilling, or payment instrument.

    The stream's periodicity determines the period of time between invoices in the stream (monthly, weekly, etc.). The anchor date or dates determine the invoicing day of month, day of week, twice-per-month days of month, etc. If BillDateOrDueDateBilling is BillDateBilling, the anchor date determines the invoice send (event) date; if BillDateOrDueDateBilling is DueDateBilling, the anchor date determines the invoice due date.

    If the stream overrides the anchor dates, its anchor dates are the overriding anchor dates. Otherwise its anchor dates are the dates provided by its payer. The stream has one or two anchor dates. It has one anchor date if the periodicity needs only one anchor date (for periodicities monthly, weekly, and every-other-week). It has two anchor dates if the periodicity needs two anchor dates (for periodicity twice-per-month).

    If the invoice payer chooses not to send invoices on a non-business day, the target bill (send) date will be adjusted to be a business day using the payer's method of adjusting for business day.

    If the invoice payer chooses not to have invoice due on a non-business day, the target due date will be adjusted to be a business day using the payer's method of adjusting for business day.

    • Method Detail

      • latestOnSequenceInvoiceDateBefore

        org.joda.time.DateTime latestOnSequenceInvoiceDateBefore(org.joda.time.DateTime date)
        The stream's latest on-sequence invoice send/bill date that is before the given date. The stream may or may not already have an invoice for that date. This returns only on-sequence invoice dates (invoice dates that are determined by the periodicity and the invoicing day of month, day of week, etc.) It does not consider existing off-sequence invoices, such as invoices created for catch-up billing and immediate billing.
        Parameters:
        date - the given date
        Returns:
        the send (bill) date of the latest on-sequence invoice that is sent (billed) before the given date

      • latestOnSequenceInvoiceDateForInvoiceDueBefore

        org.joda.time.DateTime latestOnSequenceInvoiceDateForInvoiceDueBefore(org.joda.time.DateTime date)
        Returns the bill date of the last "available" invoice in the stream. An invoice is available if its due date is before the given date. The stream may or may not already have an invoice for that date. This returns only on-sequence invoice dates (invoice dates that are determined by the periodicity and the invoicing day of month, day of week, etc.) It does not consider existing off-sequence invoices, such as invoices created for catch-up billing and immediate billing.
        Parameters:
        date - the given date
        Returns:
        the send (bill) date of the latest on-sequence invoice that is due before the given date

        Invoice createAndAddInvoice(org.joda.time.DateTime invoiceDate)
        Creates and adds an invoice to this stream to be sent (billed) on the given date
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • earliestInvoiceSatisfying

        @Nullable
Invoice earliestInvoiceSatisfying(InvoiceSpecification invoiceSpecification)
        Returns the earliest invoice that satisfies the invoice specification. If the earliest match does not exist but is an invoice that falls within the normal (on sequence) set of invoices for the stream, then this creates that invoice and returns it. Returns null if there are no existing invoices that satisfy the specification and no new on-sequence invoices would satisfy the specification.
        Parameters:
        invoiceSpecification - the invoice specification to be satisfied
        Returns:
        the earliest invoice that satisfies the invoice specification

      • earliestInvoiceSatisfying

        Invoice earliestInvoiceSatisfying(InvoiceSpecification invoiceSpecification,
                                org.joda.time.DateTime dateForNewInvoiceIfNoExistingOrOnSequenceMatch)
        Returns the earliest invoice that satisfies the invoice specification. If the earliest match does not exist but is an invoice that falls within the normal (on sequence) set of invoices for the stream, then this creates that invoice and returns it. If there are no matching existing invoices and no matching potential on-sequence invoices, then this creates and returns a new off-sequence invoice on dateForNewInvoiceIfNoOnSequenceMatch.
        Parameters:
        invoiceSpecification - the invoice specification to be satisfied
        dateForNewInvoiceIfNoExistingOrOnSequenceMatch - the billing date of the new invoice created if there is no existing or on-sequence match
        Returns:
        the earliest invoice that satisfies the invoice specification

      • getInvoiceDueDateForBillingDate

        org.joda.time.DateTime getInvoiceDueDateForBillingDate(org.joda.time.DateTime billingDate)
        Returns the due date for an invoice that is billed (sent) on the given date. The due date is leadTimeDays after the billingDate, and some invoice payers may adjust it to fall on a business day.
        Parameters:
        billingDate - the billing (event) date
        Returns:
        the due date for an invoice that is billed (sent) on the given date

      • getInvoicePayer

        InvoicePayer getInvoicePayer()
        Returns the payer of invoices in this stream.
        Returns:
        the payer of invoices in this stream.

        @Deprecated
void setAccount(Account account)
        Deprecated. (Since 7.0.0) Instead use InvoiceStreamFactory.createInvoiceStreamFor(gw.api.domain.invoice.InvoicePayer, gw.bc.system.typekey.Periodicity) to create the InvoiceStream with the specified Account.
        Sets the payer of invoices in this stream to the given account.
        Parameters:
        account - the account

      • setProducer

void setProducer(Producer producer)
        Deprecated. (Since 7.0.0) Instead use InvoiceStreamFactory.createInvoiceStreamFor(gw.api.domain.invoice.InvoicePayer, gw.bc.system.typekey.Periodicity) to create the InvoiceStream with the specified Producer.
        Sets the payer of invoices in this stream to the given producer.
        Parameters:
        producer - the producer

      • updateAfterChangeToPayerInvoicingAttribute

        void updateAfterChangeToPayerInvoicingAttribute()
        Updates the stream after a change to one of the payer's invoicing attributes. Recreates the planned non-ad-hoc invoices in the stream to reflect the payer's new invoicing attributes.

      • isPolicyLevelStream

        boolean isPolicyLevelStream()
        Returns whether this invoice stream is a policy-level stream.
        Returns:
        true if the stream is a policy-level stream

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this InvoiceStream contains no Invoices.
        Returns:
        true if this InvoiceStream contains no Invoices.

      • setOverridingAnchorDates

        void setOverridingAnchorDates(java.util.List<AnchorDate> overridingAnchorDates)
        Overrides the payer's invoice days to use the given overriding dates instead. Once the stream is overriding the payer's invoice days, changes to the payer's invoice days will have no effect on the stream.

        Recreates the planned non-ad-hoc invoices in the stream to reflect the new dates.

        Throws an IllegalArgumentException if overridingAnchorDates contains more than 2 elements.

        Parameters:
        overridingAnchorDates - the overriding dates

      • getOverridingAnchorDates

        java.util.List<AnchorDate> getOverridingAnchorDates()
        Returns the stream's overriding anchor dates. Returns an empty list if there are no overriding anchor dates.
        Returns:
        the list of overriding anchor dates

      • getAnchorDates

        java.util.List<AnchorDate> getAnchorDates()
        Returns the invoicing anchor dates used by this stream. If the stream has overriding anchor dates, this returns the overriding anchor dates. Otherwise it returns the payer's invoicing days for the stream's periodicity. For example, it returns the account's invoice day of month for an account's monthly stream if the stream does not have overriding anchor dates.
        Returns:
        the stream's invoicing anchor dates

      • getBillDateOrDueDateBilling

        BillDateOrDueDateBilling getBillDateOrDueDateBilling()
        Returns the BillDateOrDueDateBilling used by this stream. If the stream overrides BillDateOrDueDateBilling, this returns the overriding BillDateOrDueDateBilling. Otherwise it returns the payer's setting for BillDateOrDueDateBilling.
        Returns:
        the stream's BillDateOrDueDateBilling

      • getInvoicingLeadTime

        int getInvoicingLeadTime()
        Returns the InvoicingLeadTime used by this stream. If the stream overrides InvoicingLeadTime, this returns the overriding InvoicingLeadTime. Otherwise it returns the payer's InvoicingLeadTime for the stream's PaymentInstrument.
        Returns:
        the stream's InvoicingLeadTime

      • getPaymentInstrument

        PaymentInstrument getPaymentInstrument()
        Returns the PaymentInstrument used by this stream. If the stream overrides the PaymentInstrument, this returns the overriding PaymentInstrument. Otherwise it returns the payer's default PaymentInstrument.
        Returns:
        the stream's PaymentInstrument

      • getInvoicesSortedByEventDate

        java.util.Collection<Invoice> getInvoicesSortedByEventDate()
        Returns the invoices on this invoice stream , sorted from the earliest to the latest
